website_summaries.verdict: Extra flexibility across the knuckles helps maintain a tight grip.
pros: Uses a one-piece construction in the palm to yield a good feel on the bat for maximum control
Design used in construction of the gloves prevents bunching of the fabric, ensuring a comfortable fit
Offered in 2 dozen different color combinations, along with 8 size choices
cons: May not last as long as you'd like

customer_reviews.title: Not bad but more and more look to be knock offs
customer_reviews.text: Exact matches to what I purchased from a reputable sporting goods store before losing one of the pair, visually. I have since noticed that these do not have a Franklin tag on the inside like the ones bought from the store. The tag indicates where they're made as well as model number. Neither of these gloves have that. The first pic shows store bought on left, Amazon ordered on right. Also after taking a few swings in the mirror the right glove shows separation in pic 2. I've lowered my rating and expectations. I'm beginning to think they're knock offs.
customer_reviews.author: MisterReed

customer_reviews.title: ASAP Sports is a slimy retailer
customer_reviews.text: BEWARE OF RETAILER who may be fulfilling the order! Ordered a size too small for my son . . . the actual Franklin batting gloves are awesome, but the order was fulfilled by ASAP Sports, who charges a restocking fee of 15% and made me pay for return shipping. And they do not provide a phone number to call. Dark Ages mentality toward consumer . . . I would expect this from a retailer in a third-world country, not in modern-day USA. Buyer beware, but shame on them. Amazon should not allow retailers like this to take part in their distribution.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa J Muench

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves! These hold up for at least 1 ...
customer_reviews.text: Great gloves! These hold up for at least 1 season where other gloves I cant get through half the season. Just for reference I hit roughly 4-5 days/week for almost the whole year. Also...I take them off when I'm on the bases which I think adds a ton of life to the gloves. I use my old gloves for running the bases.
customer_reviews.author: dig it

customer_reviews.title: Buy at caution.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve bought about 6 pairs of these altogether. It seems these have factory defects. Some fit really well from the first time worn, others are too tight altogether, or one is fits as should and the other is too tight. Also, some have ripped apart at the seems (thumb or wrist) the second time worn. In addition, the latest a pair of the red variety were sowed pretty badly; especially on the thumb area. There was more of the bottom leather and it sticks out notoriously.
customer_reviews.author: Cesar G.

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality.
customer_reviews.text: These used to be great gloves but obviously quality control is a thing of the past. They tore the very first time my son wore them for BP this winter. Very disappointed because these were my favorite gloves back in the day and I never paid this much for them.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Yoder

customer_reviews.title: Evidence of use from a “new” pair.
customer_reviews.text: I’ll start with the positives. Fit true to size, nice clean white, great range of motion and flex. I plan on using them to go under my fielding glove (aka just one) but also to hit. However, upon opening the package, I noticed that there significant signs of wear on the right handed batting glove (picture 3). There is black/brown on the right thumb and pointer finger, as well as worn down traction along the pinky and ring fingers as well as the palm below those two fingers. The left hand glove is fine and looks brand new, but the right hand is definitely NOT new.
customer_reviews.author: Rodney M. Nelson

customer_reviews.title: May not be Genuine Franklin/Terrible Durability
customer_reviews.text: These have already completely ripped down the index finger on my right hand. I’ve worn them maybe 25-30 at bats. I’m not sure these are real franklin batting gloves if they are they have very bad stitching down the seams and I wouldn’t recommend. They fit fine and are comfortable but durability is a joke.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Shirley

customer_reviews.title: Terrible product, my hands get black dye on them even with minor sweating, low quality
customer_reviews.text: If I wear these gloves outside on a 70 degree day for 10 minutes and take them off, my hands are literally dyed black from the black dye used in the gloves coloring process. It gets under your fingernails and all over your palms, very hard to remove.
customer_reviews.author: |_|rban |_egend

customer_reviews.title: All I Will Buy
customer_reviews.text: The best batting glove for the buck, hands down. I have bought other batting gloves for my player before and these are the best fitting, longest lasting gloves we have found. We have bought other model gloves from Franklin and they don't measure up to these. My pick for now and the future.
customer_reviews.author: Keith A. Pittman

customer_reviews.title: Great customer service!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered a pair since my son grew out of his last pair and were well made previously. Gloves arrived and looked great but after wearing for one weekend tournament were falling apart and turned his hands blue. Called the manufacturer and they immediately sent a new pair even going up a size for no charge without any hassle. The new pair have held up over the summer and half of the fall ball season with no signs of falling apart, The dye still stains his hands when sweating but he loves how they feel. Well purchase again in the future.
customer_reviews.author: karyn net

customer_reviews.title: Wonder about product quality check
customer_reviews.text: Normally I feel like Franklin batting gloves are the top notch. This pair, however... The thumb is not stitched properly. The thumb is tight and uncomfortable. Hopefully with use it'll break in? They look great and all other finger wells are perfect. I've only used franklin gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian Riley

customer_reviews.title: Good but not great
customer_reviews.text: Comfort is nice that is why we bought them again. Durability is a ? because last pair only lasted 6 months
customer_reviews.author: Chino

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Less than 1 month and 8 hitting sessions later one of gloves has 2 rips in the palm. Very disappointed after paying $40
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great batting gloves
customer_reviews.text: These gloves have a quality feel to them and are really comfortable. They have held up really nice over the past few months of batting practice. I have had other brand gloves start to deteriorate on me after a month or so. The only signs of wear on these gloves are sweat stains.
customer_reviews.author: S.H.

customer_reviews.title: Vibrant Red & Yellow
customer_reviews.text: The colors are vibrant. But really there's no complaint, however I have only used them for about 10 games, as that was all that was left in our season. I wouldn't consider myself a good tester, they still work, they are still in one piece, and I have had no issues.
customer_reviews.author: D. Glackin

customer_reviews.title: Hitters gloves
customer_reviews.text: My son loves them. He has been hitting lights out since he started using them. He says the grip has allowed him more control of his bat. I see this from the back stop
customer_reviews.author: PAUL RODRIGUEZ

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality for a reasonably priced glove
customer_reviews.text: My son used these gloves for 2 full varsity seasons and 1 summer select season. Lots of Batting practice and lots of at bats. The leather held up well. They ran true to size, stitching held tight, finally wore in the palms. Good Quality for a reasonably priced glove.
customer_reviews.author: long distance daughter

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality
customer_reviews.text: Don't get fooled by Easton and Nike hype You pay for the name and "styling" Neither will help you or increase your batting average !!! These gloves are great Great quality leather and construction If it's good enough for the pros, it's good enough for my son Highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: Carl G

customer_reviews.title: A little tight
customer_reviews.text: Ordered the size according to their sizing chart. The fingers were a little long and a little tight on her hand. I assume after some use they will stretch a little and fit better. The material is good quality and should last a few seasons.
customer_reviews.author: Gold3nMan

customer_reviews.title: Very durable
customer_reviews.text: Most of the MLB can wear them so can we! I’ve been using Nike or Easton and sometimes Adidas batting gloves that don’t even last the entire season. These Gloves from Franklin have definitely been a game changer. Not only are the comfortable and durable but they are stylish as well! I would recommend these to anyone looking for a pair.
customer_reviews.author: Jdsvipers

customer_reviews.title: Stitching Immediately Fell Apart
customer_reviews.text: These gloves look good, but the stitching along the thumb-to-index finger line fell apart after one batting practice. The material seems high quality. Without durable stitching, however, you can't rely on batting gloves.
customer_reviews.author: DE area resident

customer_reviews.title: Soft, comfortable, great gripping!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these gloves for my 6'2" high school son. He loves these gloves. They grip very well to every aluminum and wood bat he has used, give a bit to fit comfortably while still snug, and help prevent vibration when hitting. Well worth the price!
customer_reviews.author: Erica

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my daughter and has used for a few months and now they’re torn from the fingers. I love Franklin but I guess throughout the years they have gotten cheaper with their materials for their batting gloves 🤦🏽‍♂️.. I guess time to buy another pair again
customer_reviews.author: Marcus Ortiz

customer_reviews.title: Hands down the best batting gloves
customer_reviews.text: Have tried many different pairs but these are truly the best. Comfortable and get great grip Lizard Skin wraps. Only complaint is I wish they would last a little longer, but isn't that the case for most anything...
customer_reviews.author: S Duval

customer_reviews.title: Different sizes? No, the same!
customer_reviews.text: My son outgrew his Youth Large size gloves. I ordered the adult small (assuming that the next larger size would work) and it is the EXACT SAME SIZE! Now I have to pay $7.00 to return the gloves that logically should be the next size up. There is no size tag in the gloves. Looks like Franklin is trying to move some mis-labeled gloves through Amazon at retail prices!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed in Franklin Gloves
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed!!! These gloves didn’t even make it to my daughters 3rd fall Softball tournament before a big hole formed in the palm of the glove. Delivered on September 12 and barely lasted a month. Spent $48.00 on these and extremely frustrated!
customer_reviews.author: Anita F. Hoekstra

customer_reviews.title: Attractive gloves, fit as expected
customer_reviews.text: Teen daughter uses for softball and loves the Royal blue color!
customer_reviews.author: Yeti

customer_reviews.title: Order one size up from normal
customer_reviews.text: I like the gloves for the price. They seem to be holding up nicely. I’ve always worn a XXL and these are pretty tight. I would have returned for a XXXL, but they didn’t offer that size. I can’t use the straps, but they’re working anyway. Would order them again if it wasn’t for the sizing issue.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Young

customer_reviews.title: Incorrect size information in product listing
customer_reviews.text: The product listing for this item states "Youth Large". When added to the cart, the product changes to size "Youth Medium". I needed these for my son's baseball game, and due to the incorrect information, the gloves did not fit. Beware of the incorrect information.

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves, best I've used.
customer_reviews.text: These are great. As for feel during BP or in a game, they're the best I've used. I did remove one star because I feel that could do a little better regarding moisture resolution. I wish they still felt closer to new the next time I pull them out of my bag after a sweaty BP session from a week previous. Maybe there's no glove on the market that can accomplish that, I don't know. Overall, these are awesome and I'd buy them again for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Kirt B.

customer_reviews.title: Five adult men's sizes but no size chart?
customer_reviews.text: Good gloves, very comfortable and seems well made. Had to dock points because for whatever reason the listing does not include a size chart. At the time of purchase they offer five different adult men's sizes and didn't think it important to include measurements. This is a good product but you need to update your listings.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Primeau

customer_reviews.title: Snug fit
customer_reviews.text: Wish they were slightly bigger as the XLs are very snug but will probably loosen up a bit with use. Otherwise a great batting glove.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew C

customer_reviews.title: High Quality
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are top notch. Their high end gloves and hold up well. You have to pay for quality and I have no problem with that.
customer_reviews.author: jrank001

customer_reviews.title: Good batting gloves
customer_reviews.text: My boys love these batting gloves. They are the best they e used to date. The price here is cheaper than anywhere else I’ve found.
customer_reviews.author: Jawja73

customer_reviews.title: Great feeling glove and it improved my hitting
customer_reviews.text: I bought these gloves to use for softball and they're fantastic. It fits me perfectly and I like the feel of them- they have nice cushioning and I can feel the bat. I don't know if it's the glove, but I hit the ball farther than I did in any of my previous games. Maybe it was mental confidence with having a new glove, but these gloves feel fantastic and I would buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: Q. Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Comfy, look great, get em!
customer_reviews.text: Not much to say other than that these are super comfy, the XXL were the perfect size for my large hands, and they work great so far, zero issues after a few batting practices
customer_reviews.author: Reed Carpenter

customer_reviews.title: Dont last long
customer_reviews.text: Ive always used franklin batting gloves. But this pair only lasted 2 games.
customer_reviews.author: jnics3

customer_reviews.title: Not For Serious Baseball Players
customer_reviews.text: The graphics looks really nice, but the material wont last long. I used the pair for two batting sessions; the gloves fell apart.
customer_reviews.author: bobby barajas

customer_reviews.title: Good batting glove
customer_reviews.text: My 14 years old plays on travel team loves it. It last for 1-2 seasons which is not bad, consider he has 2 games & 2 practices per week on average.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Provided a great season of ball. I wear one under my glove and both while batting. These are great!
customer_reviews.author: Cam M

customer_reviews.title: Great for polo players!
customer_reviews.text: My husband uses them to play polo and they are great for horse riding and grabbing the mallet!
customer_reviews.author: Anonimous

customer_reviews.title: Batter gloves
customer_reviews.text: Kid loved these gloves last season. Using them for fall ball. His first and won’t be his last Franklins
customer_reviews.author: Carl T

customer_reviews.title: Cover your hands with care
customer_reviews.text: These gloves fit perfectly. My rabbit fir lined gloves fit over them if needed. I wanted this extra cover for my hands to eliminate the problem I had last year during extra cold weather.
customer_reviews.author: FIXER

customer_reviews.title: Good quality gloves
customer_reviews.text: Good quality gloves that hopefully will last at least a season. I go thru a pair every season (60 games plus) so I hope these will last longer than my U**** A***** pair I last purchased which didn't. Good feel and grip.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Quality product
customer_reviews.text: The first pair I ordered were too small and I was easily able to return them and the larger size arrived quickly, as promised. Well packaged and great quality.
customer_reviews.author: SAA

customer_reviews.title: short lived
customer_reviews.text: The gloves tore along the seams after being used only a few times
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing to say the least
customer_reviews.text: The gloves bled a reddish color on the first use. Pretty pathetic from a big company like a Franklin. Would not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Dean L.

customer_reviews.title: I like Franklin gloves
customer_reviews.text: After using just about every batting glove brand, I find Franklin to be the most consistent in size and quality. You can’t go wrong with Franklin.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Sizemore

customer_reviews.title: Ripped after one practice
customer_reviews.text: Purchased on a May 7th. 14 year old son used it in ONE practice and when he went to take them off one of the gloves completely ripped. Don’t know if it was a manufacturer defect... but $35 for one practice kind of stinks!
customer_reviews.author: Eugena Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Best in the biz at BGs
customer_reviews.text: If you play ball, and would like a pair of BGs that you do not have to fight against and last a long time: Franklin is the best BG for the money.
customer_reviews.author: R

customer_reviews.title: Greatness !
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely Love these gloves have been using them for yearsssss
customer_reviews.author: Keisha Craig

customer_reviews.title: Great for our 10 year old son
customer_reviews.text: Great for our 10 year old son. He loves the style and fit.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: Good Batting Gloves
customer_reviews.text: Nice batting glove. Good price, held up well this season!
customer_reviews.author: Peter Gibson

customer_reviews.title: Nice glove
customer_reviews.text: Compared to other more expensive gloves these are more durable and comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Very happy.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for my mate and he was very happy.
customer_reviews.author: PhoenixAngel

customer_reviews.title: CHROME BABY
customer_reviews.text: Wear these riding my motorcycle. Gave my old ones to a homeless lady last winter. Was disappointed at first over the CHROME emblem, however I've had several compliments over the chrome matching my bike. Will buy again.
customer_reviews.author: will mealor

customer_reviews.title: My Sons Favorite Gloves
customer_reviews.text: Soft and durable. We’ve always had good luck with these and he uses them every day
customer_reviews.author: Pen Name

customer_reviews.title: The are very comfortable. She plays softball pretty much year around and ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought these gloves for my 14 yr old daughter and she loves them. The are very comfortable. She plays softball pretty much year around and the CFX are the only brand we have bought that lasts over a year.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Durable and good looking
customer_reviews.text: My son is really impressed with these batting gloves and he has busted through just about every brand on the market.
customer_reviews.author: Allie

customer_reviews.title: Good fit, good value on less popular color.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect fit. My son loves it! Great value on the less popular color
customer_reviews.author: TJV Golfer

customer_reviews.title: great gloves
customer_reviews.text: Gloves fit perfect and quality great for the price. I use these in the batting cages so far about 20 times and no signs of wear yet.
customer_reviews.author: realist

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply Made
customer_reviews.text: These gloves did not last long. We received them in July and they already ripped. I do NOT recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: JF

customer_reviews.title: BAD
customer_reviews.text: These batting gloves don't last, after 3 weeks of use they were falling apart. BAD QUALITY
customer_reviews.author: Jose Corral

customer_reviews.title: The best gloves for the money and they will last a ...
customer_reviews.text: The best gloves for the money and they will last a whole season for any baseball player. Both my boy's play baseball and are rough on equipment and these are the best!
customer_reviews.author: History

customer_reviews.title: Junk and I don't know where to send them back for replacement
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased this batting gloves before and they lasted me well over a year the new pair I got for Christmas and I barely started using them and they're coming apart I've only worn them about 4 times a truly piece of junk I will not be buying Franklin gloves ever again .
customer_reviews.author: Lety Trujillo

customer_reviews.title: Best Batting Gloves (Hands Down)
customer_reviews.text: I have 4 colors (red, grey, blue and black) Will not buy another glove
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just will keep looking for a good pair of gloves that aren't so poorly made
customer_reviews.text: As with other buyers the gloves I purchased are badly sewn. The 3 slats on the front unraveled the moment my husband put them on. I had to sew around all 6 of them because he needed to wear them. Just will keep looking for a good pair of gloves that aren't so poorly made.
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: Feels smaller then expected
customer_reviews.text: I wear large size batting gloves and these one are really tight on my fingers.
customer_reviews.author: ellis b

customer_reviews.title: Franklin Sports Baseball Batting Gloves
customer_reviews.text: Our grandson loves them. Was a Christmas present to him
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: Not very durable
customer_reviews.text: My son purchased the gloves and after being worn about 6 times the whole seam by his thumb came unstitched ordered the same pair again worn 2 times and the new pair the seam is starting to open
customer_reviews.author: eg

customer_reviews.title: I use Franklin Batting gloves and nothing else
customer_reviews.text: I've been using Franklin gloves for most of my baseball career. I'm currently in college and find that these gloves last longer than most. They are very comfortable and with all the hits we take, they work well!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Run a little bit big
customer_reviews.text: We're a bit big for an 11 and a half year old... Youth medium. But not so big we need to return. They seem to be working very well.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal D

customer_reviews.title: Blister after one batting practice session
customer_reviews.text: It took one practice at the batting cage and I got a blister. These gloves fit fairly nice in the fingers, but there's no palm protection at all it seems. The gap where the velcro closes seemed too high up on my gloves and it caused friction and a huge blister on my left palm. Maybe the gloves were too small, but I got the same size(large) as my previous Louisville Slugger gloves. I can't endorse these.
customer_reviews.author: Dmitry

customer_reviews.title: Very durable
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable. They fit very well with very few wrinkles. They feel very durable.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent B.

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my son. Less than 1 month the gloves ripped. Not good quality. Do not reccomend
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Crap quay 0 star ls
customer_reviews.text: I don’t even have 3 month with then and I don’t play every day either so this is a crap quality don’t waste u money on this
customer_reviews.author: Orlando castillo

customer_reviews.title: Works good looks good!
customer_reviews.text: My son used it right away and loves it! He uses his gloves till they have holes.
customer_reviews.author: lokelani 2

customer_reviews.title: Very nice looking
customer_reviews.text: Great other than the Franklin logo falls off, this has happen with all of my Franklin's gloves.
customer_reviews.author: carlos

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: These are by far the best batting gloves in every aspect and the price
customer_reviews.author: Adrian

customer_reviews.title: but otherwise seem to be good.
customer_reviews.text: A little tight for what usually fits me well in a large (so seems to run a little small), but otherwise seem to be good.
customer_reviews.author: sporting road

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves
customer_reviews.text: Lasted along time. I hit thousands of balls per week and it protects my hands allowing me to train longer every session.
customer_reviews.author: 808 Lathe Dog

customer_reviews.title: Good batting glove
customer_reviews.text: Good batting glove, it's the only one My 12 year old will wear, the knuckles remind him to line up and help keep his swing level, only down side is the cost, he's already on his second pair this season, he does play travel ball so they get a lot. of use
customer_reviews.author: Bryan S.

customer_reviews.title: great gloves
customer_reviews.text: 2nd pair I got, got the wrong size before, freat fit and feel very durable had play for 2 seasons with them and in steel in very good shape.
customer_reviews.author: rpaltam

customer_reviews.title: Nice Batting Gloves
customer_reviews.text: My 11 year old son loves them. He is so picky with batting gloves, I will probably buy a couple more pairs.
customer_reviews.author: S.Maher

customer_reviews.title: they still have some good life in them
customer_reviews.text: Son just finished spring season. Used them since early January, they still have some good life in them.
customer_reviews.author: Jairo Poveda

customer_reviews.title: Finger stitching came undone after two games played.
customer_reviews.text: Franklin has gone cheap like other brands over the years. Very unhappy with this purchase. Cheap stitching coming undone after about 20 swings. Hello to Franklin from a guy who has submitted multiple support requests..tried contacting support for my order and haven't heard back in a month.
customer_reviews.author: Travis M.

customer_reviews.title: Great price!
customer_reviews.text: I use these for upland hunting. The thin leather is so comfortable in warmer weather.
customer_reviews.author: Kurt Kragt

customer_reviews.title: Good quality!
customer_reviews.text: My son goes through several pairs a year. These have lasted the longest. Good quality
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Great glove
customer_reviews.text: This was for my grandson and he loves it! Good fit and helps his hitting!
customer_reviews.author: N. Johns

customer_reviews.title: Fit guide led us to buy one size TOO BIG
customer_reviews.text: Fit was larger than the guide suggested. Having to buy a size down. We'll keep these for the future.
customer_reviews.author: NMChknHwk

customer_reviews.title: Top quality
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable and nice grip . Will definitely buy them again !
customer_reviews.author: Rick B

customer_reviews.title: Durable
customer_reviews.text: These batting gloves really last. This is great if you take a lot of batting practice, These gloves have outlasted the other brands we tried.
customer_reviews.author: plhiatt

customer_reviews.title: Well made pair of gloves!
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what he was looking for. Well made pair of gloves!
customer_reviews.author: Mom of 2 Boys

customer_reviews.title: Franklin Gloves are the best gloves by far
customer_reviews.text: Franklin Gloves are the best gloves by far. The material and fit are the best. i highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Maverick

customer_reviews.title: Ripped after two games...
customer_reviews.text: Fall Ball just started up. Bought August 6th, just outside return period.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: comfortable and sticky but velcro may not last
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if the velcro is sturdy enough, time will tell
customer_reviews.author: Tttjjjsss

customer_reviews.title: Very good quality
customer_reviews.text: Fit very well. Have used for 5 games or so and still look new.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Page

customer_reviews.title: Not durable
customer_reviews.text: I bought these gloves because they seemed super durable, couldn’t be further from the truth. They ripped right up the palm on my first at bat and the first time I used them. Complete waste of money, and I will not buy Franklin ever again.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle pebbles

customer_reviews.title: Overall good, except for the Smurf hands.
customer_reviews.text: Feels good, looks good, only issue is the bleeding of the blue dye. After 10 uses, my thumbs still turn blue after use.
customer_reviews.author: PJH

customer_reviews.title: poor conditions
customer_reviews.text: after a few days of used it the batting glove has broke and it's impossible to get that a brand new item pass to this condition by this quickly way.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Enmanuel Vasquez Vargas

product_meta.title: Franklin Sports MLB CFX Pro Baseball and Softball Batting Gloves
product_meta.description: The Franklin Sports CFX Pro Series is Franklin's most popular on-field model. These batting gloves offer a superior feel that is complemented by unique, tectonic-fit insert flexibility. The world-class quality, one-piece Pittards Digital Sheepskin leather palm maintains softness and superior grip in all conditions while the digital leather provides strategically etched grooves to reduce palm bunching and improve grip. These gloves are a must have on the diamond this season!
feature_bullets: PRO CHOICE: As the official batting gloves of the MLB, the CFX Pro is the most popular on field batting glove used by MLB pros
PREMIUM QUALITY: Constructed from premium quality leather, these gloves are designed to play at peak performance season after season with no tears or bunching
NATURAL FIT: These gloves are made specially to fit the naturally curves of the hand to ensure that they fit comfortably and provide a responsive, natural feel
COMFORT: Tectonic fit inserts accommodate flex without adding bulk to the back of the hand
ALL SIZES: These gloves come in all youth and adult sizes so that you can pick the perfect fit for you
